question: 3 (b)
sols_html:
The area of the region bounded by the graph of \(f\) and the \(x\)- axis is

\[\begin{aligned} A&= \int_{-1}^2 \left|f(x)\right|\, dx \\ &= \int_{-1}^0 f(x)\, dx + \int_0^2 (-f(x)) \, dx\\ &= \int_{-1}^0 (x^3-x^2-2x)\, dx + \int_0^2 (-x^3+x^2+2x) \, dx\\ &= \left[\frac{x^4}4-\frac{x^3}{3}-x^2\right]_{-1}^0 + \left[-\frac{x^4}4+\frac{x^3}{3}+x^2\right]_{0}^2\\ &=-\frac{(-1)^4}4+\frac{(-1)^3}{3}+(-1)^2 -\frac{2^4}4+\frac{2^3}{3}+2^2\\ &=-\frac{1}4-\frac{1}{3}+1 -4+\frac{8}{3}+4\\ &=-\frac{1}4+1 +\frac{7}{3}\\ &=-\frac{1}4+3 +\frac{1}{3}\\ &=3+\frac1{12} = \frac{37}{12}.\end{aligned}\]

In the third line, we’ve expanded the factors of \(f(x)\) into the sum

\[\begin{aligned} f(x)=x(x-2)(x+1) = x(x^2-x-2)=x^3-x^2-2x.\end{aligned}\]
sols_latex:
The area of the region bounded by the graph of $f$ and the $x$- axis is

\begin{align*}
A&= \int_{-1}^2 \left|f(x)\right|\, dx \\
&= \int_{-1}^0 f(x)\, dx + \int_0^2 (-f(x)) \, dx\\
&= \int_{-1}^0 (x^3-x^2-2x)\, dx + \int_0^2 (-x^3+x^2+2x) \, dx\\
&= \left[\frac{x^4}4-\frac{x^3}{3}-x^2\right]_{-1}^0  + \left[-\frac{x^4}4+\frac{x^3}{3}+x^2\right]_{0}^2\\
&=-\frac{(-1)^4}4+\frac{(-1)^3}{3}+(-1)^2  -\frac{2^4}4+\frac{2^3}{3}+2^2\\
&=-\frac{1}4-\frac{1}{3}+1 -4+\frac{8}{3}+4\\
&=-\frac{1}4+1 +\frac{7}{3}\\
&=-\frac{1}4+3 +\frac{1}{3}\\
&=3+\frac1{12} = \frac{37}{12}.
\end{align*}

In the third line, we've expanded the factors of $f(x)$ into the sum

\begin{align*}
f(x)=x(x-2)(x+1) = x(x^2-x-2)=x^3-x^2-2x.
\end{align*}
